item.title: Lower road shops needs cleaning up - litter issue, 6th September
item.description:
Litter all over the floor outside the shops and down the road, bin needed where the bin has gone at the bus stop opposite Chinese takeaway

item.title: Someone has dumped a load of rubbish and large amounts of grass and tree cuttings on the footpath, 6th September
item.description:
Someone has dumped a load of rubbish and large amounts of grass and tree cuttings on the footpath on Wednesday or Thursday, It is starting to rot and attracting foxes etc. I am not sure where it has come from but I noticed that grass and trees have been cut in St Paul’s Terrace (adjacent street)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frederick Road, Kennington, London

item.title: Deceased animal under the wall, 6th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Street, New Cross, London

item.title: Mattress, bed frame and furniture, 6th September
item.description:
Beside the recycling bins between Tomson and Attilburgh House SE1 3DL. This mattress, bed frame, clothes dryer and side table plus other detritus have been here for about a week, now. Southwark's last communication stated that you were making regular inspections for flytipping, but this doesn't appear to have worked, hence this report. Please could you remove these items.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riley Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defective Manhole, 6th September
item.description:
I am writing to report a defective manhole cover located on Clapham High Street. Each time a vehicle passes over the cover it produces a loud metallic bang akin to a gun‑shot. The noise is frequent—particularly during the night—and has become a significant disturbance; I am unable to open my windows and my sleep is severely affected. In addition to the noise nuisance, the rocking cover poses a potential danger to road users and pedestrians should the ironwork fail.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102-104, Clapham High Street, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
